THE GREAT AMEITUKE; HUMBER OHS
^0G; All this eastern coast of America is low and picturesque, In this
country covered by impenetrable forests two centuries ago, you have
trouble finding a tree0 As for the harbour and the city itself, well,
picture to yourself an attractively vailed shoreline* the slopes covered
by lawns and trees in bloom right down to the water and more 'than all
that, an unbelievable multitude of country houses, big as boxes of
candy, but showing careful workmanship; add to this, if you can a sea
covered with sails, and you will have the entrance to the city from the
watero I have been much struck by how convenient these little houses
must be, and by the attractive air they gave the countryside0 Such, was
our first impression of the city of New York,
